action_prefilter.name: {$action}_prefilter
action_prefilter.summary: Filters the data for a file before it is uploaded to WordPress.
action_prefilter.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $action, refers to the post action.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of data for a single file.

add_menu_classes.name: add_menu_classes
add_menu_classes.summary: Filters administration menus array with classes added for top-level items.

menu.label: menu
menu.description: Associative array of administration menu items.

add_meta_type_metadata.name: add_{$meta_type}_metadata
add_meta_type_metadata.summary: Filters whether to add metadata of a specific type.
add_meta_type_metadata.description: The dynamic portion of the hook, $meta_type, refers to the meta object type (comment, post, term, or user). Returning a non-null value will effectively short-circuit the function.

check.label: check
check.description: Whether to allow adding metadata for the given type.

meta_value.label: meta_value
meta_value.description: Meta value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.

unique.label: unique
unique.description: Whether the specified meta key should be unique for the object. Optional. Default false.

add_ping.name: add_ping
add_ping.summary: Filters the new ping URL to add for the given post.

add_signup_meta.name: add_signup_meta
add_signup_meta.summary: Filters the new default site meta variables.

meta.label: meta
meta.description:
An array of default site meta variables.
  • 'lang_id'
    (int) The language ID.
  • 'blog_public'
    (int) Whether search engines should be discouraged from indexing the site. 1 for true, 0 for false.

additional_capabilities_display.name: additional_capabilities_display
additional_capabilities_display.summary: Filters whether to display additional capabilities for the user.
additional_capabilities_display.description: The 'Additional Capabilities' section will only be enabled if the number of the user's capabilities exceeds their number of roles.

enable.label: enable
enable.description: Whether to display the capabilities. Default true.

adjacent_image_link.name: {$adjacent}_image_link
adjacent_image_link.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $adjacent, refers to the type of adjacency, either 'next', or 'previous'.

size.label: size
size.description: Image size.

adjacent_post_link.name: {$adjacent}_post_link
adjacent_post_link.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $adjacent, refers to the type of adjacency, 'next' or 'previous'.

adjacent.label: adjacent
adjacent.description: Whether the post is previous or next.

adjacent_post_rel_link.name: {$adjacent}_post_rel_link
adjacent_post_rel_link.summary: Filters the adjacent post relational link.
adjacent_post_rel_link.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $adjacent, refers to the type of adjacency, 'next' or 'previous'.

admin_body_class.name: admin_body_class
admin_body_class.summary: Filters the CSS classes for the body tag in the admin.
admin_body_class.description:
This filter differs from the {@see 'post_class'} and {@see 'body_class'} filters in two important ways:

  • $classes is a space-separated string of class names instead of an array.
  • Not all core admin classes are filterable, notably: wp-admin, wp-core-ui, and no-js cannot be removed.

admin_comment_types_dropdown.name: admin_comment_types_dropdown
admin_comment_types_dropdown.summary: Filters the comment types dropdown menu.

comment_types.label: comment_types
comment_types.description: An array of comment types. Accepts 'Comments', 'Pings'.

admin_footer_text.name: admin_footer_text
admin_footer_text.summary: Filters the "Thank you" text displayed in the admin footer.

text.label: text
text.description: The content that will be printed.

admin_memory_limit.name: admin_memory_limit
admin_memory_limit.summary: Filters the maximum memory limit available for administration screens.
admin_memory_limit.description:
This only applies to administrators, who may require more memory for tasks like updates. Memory limits when processing images (uploaded or edited by users of any role) are handled separately.

The WP_MAX_MEMORY_LIMIT constant specifically defines the maximum memory limit available when in the administration back end. The default is 256M (256 megabytes of memory) or the original memory_limit php.ini value if this is higher.

filtered_limit.label: filtered_limit
filtered_limit.description: The maximum WordPress memory limit. Accepts an integer (bytes), or a shorthand string notation, such as '256M'.

admin_post_thumbnail_html.name: admin_post_thumbnail_html
admin_post_thumbnail_html.summary: Filters the admin post thumbnail HTML markup to return.

thumbnail_id.label: thumbnail_id
thumbnail_id.description: Thumbnail attachment ID, or null if there isn't one.

admin_post_thumbnail_size.name: admin_post_thumbnail_size
admin_post_thumbnail_size.summary: Filters the size used to display the post thumbnail image in the 'Featured Image' meta box.
admin_post_thumbnail_size.description: Note: When a theme adds 'post-thumbnail' support, a special 'post-thumbnail' image size is registered, which differs from the 'thumbnail' image size managed via the Settings > Media screen. See the $size parameter description for more information on default values.

size.label: size
size.description: Post thumbnail image size to display in the meta box. Accepts any valid image size, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order). If the 'post-thumbnail' size is set, default is 'post-thumbnail'. Otherwise, default is an array with 266 as both the height and width values.

post.label: post
post.description: The post object associated with the thumbnail.

admin_referrer_policy.name: admin_referrer_policy
admin_referrer_policy.summary: Filters the admin referrer policy header value.

policy.label: policy
policy.description: The admin referrer policy header value. Default 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin'.

admin_title.name: admin_title
admin_title.summary: Filters the title tag content for an admin page.

admin_title.label: admin_title
admin_title.description: The page title, with extra context added.

url.label: url
url.description: The complete admin area URL including scheme and path.

path.label: path
path.description: Path relative to the admin area URL. Blank string if no path is specified.

blog_id.label: blog_id
blog_id.description: Site ID, or null for the current site.

ajax_query_attachments_args.name: ajax_query_attachments_args
ajax_query_attachments_args.summary: Filters the arguments passed to WP_Query during an Ajax call for querying attachments.

all_plugins.name: all_plugins
all_plugins.summary: Filters the full array of plugins to list in the Plugins list table.

all_plugins.label: all_plugins
all_plugins.description: An array of plugins to display in the list table.

all_themes.name: all_themes
all_themes.summary: Filters the full array of WP_Theme objects to list in the Multisite themes list table.

all.label: all
all.description: Array of WP_Theme objects to display in the list table.

alloptions.name: alloptions
alloptions.summary: Filters all options after retrieving them.

allow_dev_auto_core_updates.name: allow_dev_auto_core_updates
allow_dev_auto_core_updates.summary: Filters whether to enable automatic core updates for development versions.

upgrade_dev.label: upgrade_dev
upgrade_dev.description: Whether to enable automatic updates for development versions.

allow_empty_comment.name: allow_empty_comment
allow_empty_comment.summary: Filters whether an empty comment should be allowed.

allow_empty_comment.label: allow_empty_comment
allow_empty_comment.description: Whether to allow empty comments. Default false.

commentdata.label: commentdata
commentdata.description: Array of comment data to be sent to wp_insert_comment().

allow_major_auto_core_updates.name: allow_major_auto_core_updates
allow_major_auto_core_updates.summary: Filters whether to enable major automatic core updates.

upgrade_major.label: upgrade_major
upgrade_major.description: Whether to enable major automatic core updates.

allow_minor_auto_core_updates.name: allow_minor_auto_core_updates
allow_minor_auto_core_updates.summary: Filters whether to enable minor automatic core updates.

upgrade_minor.label: upgrade_minor
upgrade_minor.description: Whether to enable minor automatic core updates.

allow_password_reset.name: allow_password_reset
allow_password_reset.summary: Filters whether to allow a password to be reset.

allow.label: allow
allow.description: Whether to allow the password to be reset. Default true.

user_data->ID.label: user_data->ID
user_data->ID.description: The ID of the user attempting to reset a password.

allow_subdirectory_install.name: allow_subdirectory_install
allow_subdirectory_install.summary: Filters whether to enable the subdirectory installation feature in Multisite.

allow.label: allow
allow.description: Whether to enable the subdirectory installation feature in Multisite. Default is false.

allowed_block_types.name: allowed_block_types
allowed_block_types.summary: Filters the allowed block types for the editor, defaulting to true (all block types supported).

allowed_block_types.label: allowed_block_types
allowed_block_types.description: Array of block type slugs, or boolean to enable/disable all.

allowed_http_origin.name: allowed_http_origin
allowed_http_origin.summary: Change the allowed HTTP origin result.

origin.label: origin
origin.description: Origin URL if allowed, empty string if not.

origin_arg.label: origin_arg
origin_arg.description: Original origin string passed into is_allowed_http_origin function.

allowed_http_origins.name: allowed_http_origins
allowed_http_origins.summary: Change the origin types allowed for HTTP requests.

allowed_origins.label: allowed_origins
allowed_origins.description:
Default allowed HTTP origins.
  • 'Non-secure'
    (string) URL for admin origin.
  • 'Secure'
    (string) URL for admin origin.
  • 'Non-secure'
    (string) URL for home origin.
  • 'Secure'
    (string) URL for home origin.

allowed_redirect_hosts.name: allowed_redirect_hosts
allowed_redirect_hosts.summary: Filters the whitelist of hosts to redirect to.

host.label: host
host.description: The parsed host; empty if not isset.

allowed_themes.name: allowed_themes
allowed_themes.summary: Filters the array of themes allowed on the network.

allowed_themes.label: allowed_themes
allowed_themes.description: An array of theme stylesheet names.

async_update_translation.name: async_update_translation
async_update_translation.summary: Filters whether to asynchronously update translation for core, a plugin, or a theme.

async_upload_type.name: async_upload_{$type}
async_upload_type.summary: Filters the returned ID of an uploaded attachment.
async_upload_type.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $type, refers to the attachment type, such as 'image', 'audio', 'video', 'file', etc.

atom_enclosure.name: atom_enclosure
atom_enclosure.summary: Filters the atom enclosure HTML link tag for the current post.

html_link_tag.label: html_link_tag
html_link_tag.description: The HTML link tag with a URI and other attributes.

attach_session_information.name: attach_session_information
attach_session_information.summary: Filters the information attached to the newly created session.
attach_session_information.description: Can be used to attach further information to a session.

attachment_fields_to_edit.name: attachment_fields_to_edit
attachment_fields_to_edit.summary: Filters the attachment fields to edit.

form_fields.label: form_fields
form_fields.description: An array of attachment form fields.

attachment_fields_to_save.name: attachment_fields_to_save
attachment_fields_to_save.summary: Filters the attachment fields to be saved.

attachment_link.name: attachment_link
attachment_link.summary: Filters the permalink for an attachment.

attachment_thumbnail_args.name: attachment_thumbnail_args
attachment_thumbnail_args.summary: Filters the parameters for the attachment thumbnail creation.

image_attachment.label: image_attachment
image_attachment.description: An array of parameters to create the thumbnail.

uploaded.label: uploaded
uploaded.description: An array containing the thumbnail path and url.

attachment_url_to_postid.name: attachment_url_to_postid
attachment_url_to_postid.summary: Filters an attachment id found by URL.

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post_id (if any) found by the function.

attribute_escape.name: attribute_escape
attribute_escape.summary: Filters a string cleaned and escaped for output in an HTML attribute.
attribute_escape.description: Text passed to esc_attr() is stripped of invalid or special characters before output.

safe_text.label: safe_text
safe_text.description: The text after it has been escaped.

text.label: text
text.description: The text prior to being escaped.

audio_submitbox_misc_sections.name: audio_submitbox_misc_sections
audio_submitbox_misc_sections.summary: Filters the audio attachment metadata fields to be shown in the publish meta box.
audio_submitbox_misc_sections.description: The key for each item in the array should correspond to an attachment metadata key, and the value should be the desired label.

fields.label: fields
fields.description: An array of the attachment metadata keys and labels.

post.label: post
post.description: WP_Post object for the current attachment.

expiration.label: expiration
expiration.description: The time the cookie expires as a UNIX timestamp.

auth_cookie_expiration.name: auth_cookie_expiration
auth_cookie_expiration.summary: Filters the duration of the authentication cookie expiration period.

length.label: length
length.description: Duration of the expiration period in seconds.

remember.label: remember
remember.description: Whether to remember the user login. Default false.

auth_object_type_meta_meta_key.name: auth_{$object_type}_meta_{$meta_key}
auth_object_type_meta_meta_key.summary: Filters whether the user is allowed to edit a specific meta key of a specific object type.
auth_object_type_meta_meta_key.description:
Return true to have the mapped meta caps from edit_{$object_type} apply.

The dynamic portion of the hook name, $object_type refers to the object type being filtered. The dynamic portion of the hook name, $meta_key, refers to the meta key passed to map_meta_cap().

allowed.label: allowed
allowed.description: Whether the user can add the object meta. Default false.

auth_object_type_meta_meta_key_for_objec.name: auth_{$object_type}_meta_{$meta_key}_for_{$object_subtype}
auth_object_type_meta_meta_key_for_objec.summary: Filters whether the user is allowed to edit a specific meta key of a specific object type and subtype.
auth_object_type_meta_meta_key_for_objec.description: The dynamic portions of the hook name, $object_type, $meta_key, and $object_subtype, refer to the metadata object type (comment, post, term or user), the meta key value, and the object subtype respectively.

allowed.label: allowed
allowed.description: Whether the user can add the object meta. Default false.

authenticate.name: authenticate
authenticate.summary: Filters whether a set of user login credentials are valid.
authenticate.description: A WP_User object is returned if the credentials authenticate a user. WP_Error or null otherwise.

user.label: user
user.description: WP_User if the user is authenticated. WP_Error or null otherwise.

author_email.name: author_email
author_email.summary: Filters the comment author's email for display.

author_feed_link.name: author_feed_link
author_feed_link.summary: Filters the feed link for a given author.

author_link.name: author_link
author_link.summary: Filters the URL to the author's page.

link.label: link
link.description: The URL to the author's page.

author_rewrite_rules.name: author_rewrite_rules
author_rewrite_rules.summary: Filters rewrite rules used for author archives.
author_rewrite_rules.description: Likely author archives would include /author/author-name/, as well as pagination and feed paths for author archives.

author_rewrite.label: author_rewrite
author_rewrite.description: The rewrite rules for author archives.

auto_core_update_email.name: auto_core_update_email
auto_core_update_email.summary: Filters the email sent following an automatic background core update.

email.label: email
email.description:
Array of email arguments that will be passed to wp_mail().
  • 'to'
    (string) The email recipient. An array of emails can be returned, as handled by wp_mail().
  • 'subject'
    (string) The email's subject.
  • 'body'
    (string) The email message body.
  • 'headers'
    (string) Any email headers, defaults to no headers.

type.label: type
type.description: The type of email being sent. Can be one of 'success', 'fail', 'manual', 'critical'.

core_update.label: core_update
core_update.description: The update offer that was attempted.

result.label: result
result.description: The result for the core update. Can be WP_Error.

auto_core_update_send_email.name: auto_core_update_send_email
auto_core_update_send_email.summary: Filters whether to send an email following an automatic background core update.

send.label: send
send.description: Whether to send the email. Default true.

type.label: type
type.description: The type of email to send. Can be one of 'success', 'fail', 'critical'.

core_update.label: core_update
core_update.description: The update offer that was attempted.

result.label: result
result.description: The result for the core update. Can be WP_Error.

auto_update_type.name: auto_update_{$type}
auto_update_type.summary: Filters whether to automatically update core, a plugin, a theme, or a language.
auto_update_type.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $type, refers to the type of update being checked. Can be 'core', 'theme', 'plugin', or 'translation'.

Generally speaking, plugins, themes, and major core versions are not updated by default, while translations and minor and development versions for core are updated by default.

See the {@see 'allow_dev_auto_core_updates'}, {@see 'allow_minor_auto_core_updates'}, and {@see 'allow_major_auto_core_updates'} filters for a more straightforward way to adjust core updates.

autocomplete_users_for_site_admins.name: autocomplete_users_for_site_admins
autocomplete_users_for_site_admins.summary: Filters whether to enable user auto-complete for non-super admins in Multisite.

enable.label: enable
enable.description: Whether to enable auto-complete for non-super admins. Default false.

automatic_updater_disabled.name: automatic_updater_disabled
automatic_updater_disabled.summary: Filters whether to entirely disable background updates.
automatic_updater_disabled.description:
There are more fine-grained filters and controls for selective disabling. This filter parallels the AUTOMATIC_UPDATER_DISABLED constant in name.

This also disables update notification emails. That may change in the future.

disabled.label: disabled
disabled.description: Whether the updater should be disabled.

automatic_updates_debug_email.name: automatic_updates_debug_email
automatic_updates_debug_email.summary: Filters the debug email that can be sent following an automatic background core update.

email.label: email
email.description:
Array of email arguments that will be passed to wp_mail().
  • 'to'
    (string) The email recipient. An array of emails can be returned, as handled by wp_mail().
  • 'subject'
    (string) Email subject.
  • 'body'
    (string) Email message body.
  • 'headers'
    (string) Any email headers. Default empty.

failures.label: failures
failures.description: The number of failures encountered while upgrading.

results.label: results
results.description: The results of all attempted updates.

automatic_updates_is_vcs_checkout.name: automatic_updates_is_vcs_checkout
automatic_updates_is_vcs_checkout.summary: Filters whether the automatic updater should consider a filesystem location to be potentially managed by a version control system.

checkout.label: checkout
checkout.description: Whether a VCS checkout was discovered at $context or ABSPATH, or anywhere higher.

context.label: context
context.description: The filesystem context (a path) against which filesystem status should be checked.

automatic_updates_send_debug_email.name: automatic_updates_send_debug_email
automatic_updates_send_debug_email.summary: Filters whether to send a debugging email for each automatic background update.

development_version.label: development_version
development_version.description: By default, emails are sent if the install is a development version. Return false to avoid the email.

available_permalink_structure_tags.name: available_permalink_structure_tags
available_permalink_structure_tags.summary: Filters the list of available permalink structure tags on the Permalinks settings page.

available_tags.label: available_tags
available_tags.description: An array of key => value pairs of available permalink structure tags.

avatar_defaults.name: avatar_defaults
avatar_defaults.description: Avatars are stored in key/value pairs, where the key is option value, and the name is the displayed avatar name.

block_categories.name: block_categories
block_categories.summary: Filter the default array of block categories.

block_editor_no_javascript_message.name: block_editor_no_javascript_message
block_editor_no_javascript_message.summary: Filters the message displayed in the block editor interface when JavaScript is not enabled in the browser.

block_editor_preload_paths.name: block_editor_preload_paths
block_editor_preload_paths.summary: Preload common data by specifying an array of REST API paths that will be preloaded.
block_editor_preload_paths.description: Filters the array of paths that will be preloaded.

block_editor_settings.name: block_editor_settings
block_editor_settings.summary: Filters the settings to pass to the block editor.

block_local_requests.name: block_local_requests
block_local_requests.summary: Filters whether to block local requests through the proxy.

block.label: block
block.description: Whether to block local requests through proxy. Default false.

block_parser_class.name: block_parser_class
block_parser_class.summary: Filter to allow plugins to replace the server-side block parser

blog_option_option.name: blog_option_{$option}
blog_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the blog option name.

blog_redirect_404.name: blog_redirect_404
blog_redirect_404.summary: Filters the redirect URL for 404s on the main site.
blog_redirect_404.description: The filter is only evaluated if the NOBLOGREDIRECT constant is defined.

no_blog_redirect.label: no_blog_redirect
no_blog_redirect.description: The redirect URL defined in NOBLOGREDIRECT.

bloginfo.name: bloginfo
bloginfo.summary: Filters the site information returned by get_bloginfo().

bloginfo_rss.name: bloginfo_rss
bloginfo_rss.summary: Filters the bloginfo for display in RSS feeds.

rss_container.label: rss_container
rss_container.description: RSS container for the blog information.

show.label: show
show.description: The type of blog information to retrieve.

bloginfo_url.name: bloginfo_url
bloginfo_url.summary: Filters the URL returned by get_bloginfo().

body_class.name: body_class
body_class.summary: Filters the list of CSS body class names for the current post or page.

classes.label: classes
classes.description: An array of body class names.

class.label: class
class.description: An array of additional class names added to the body.

browse-happy-notice.name: browse-happy-notice
browse-happy-notice.summary: Filters the notice output for the 'Browse Happy' nag meta box.

response.label: response
response.description: An array containing web browser information. See wp_check_browser_version().

bulk_actions-this-screen-id.name: bulk_actions-{$this->screen->id}
bulk_actions-this-screen-id.summary: Filters the list table Bulk Actions drop-down.
bulk_actions-this-screen-id.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $this->screen->id, refers to the ID of the current screen, usually a string.

This filter can currently only be used to remove bulk actions.

actions.label: actions
actions.description: An array of the available bulk actions.

bulk_post_updated_messages.name: bulk_post_updated_messages
bulk_post_updated_messages.summary: Filters the bulk action updated messages.
bulk_post_updated_messages.description: By default, custom post types use the messages for the 'post' post type.

bulk_messages.label: bulk_messages
bulk_messages.description: Arrays of messages, each keyed by the corresponding post type. Messages are keyed with 'updated', 'locked', 'deleted', 'trashed', and 'untrashed'.

bulk_counts.label: bulk_counts
bulk_counts.description: Array of item counts for each message, used to build internationalized strings.

can_add_user_to_blog.name: can_add_user_to_blog
can_add_user_to_blog.summary: Filters whether a user should be added to a site.

retval.label: retval
retval.description: True if the user should be added to the site, false or error object otherwise.

can_edit_network.name: can_edit_network
can_edit_network.summary: Filters whether this network can be edited from this page.

result.label: result
result.description: Whether the network can be edited from this page.

cancel_comment_reply_link.name: cancel_comment_reply_link
cancel_comment_reply_link.summary: Filters the cancel comment reply link HTML.

formatted_link.label: formatted_link
formatted_link.description: The HTML-formatted cancel comment reply link.

category_css_class.name: category_css_class
category_css_class.summary: Filters the list of CSS classes to include with each category in the list.

css_classes.label: css_classes
css_classes.description: An array of CSS classes to be applied to each list item.

depth.label: depth
depth.description: Depth of page, used for padding.

args.label: args
args.description: An array of wp_list_categories() arguments.

category_description.name: category_description
category_description.summary: Filters the category description for display.

check_is_user_spammed.name: check_is_user_spammed
check_is_user_spammed.summary: Filters whether the user has been marked as a spammer.

spammed.label: spammed
spammed.description: Whether the user is considered a spammer.

check_password.name: check_password
check_password.summary: Filters whether the plaintext password matches the encrypted password.

clean_url.name: clean_url
clean_url.summary: Filters a string cleaned and escaped for output as a URL.

good_protocol_url.label: good_protocol_url
good_protocol_url.description: The cleaned URL to be returned.

_context.label: _context
_context.description: If 'display', replace ampersands and single quotes only.

close_comments_for_post_types.name: close_comments_for_post_types
close_comments_for_post_types.summary: Filters the list of post types to automatically close comments for.

post_types.label: post_types
post_types.description: An array of post type names.

comment_author.name: comment_author
comment_author.summary: Filters the comment author's name for display.

comment_author_rss.name: comment_author_rss
comment_author_rss.summary: Filters the current comment author for use in a feed.

comment_class.name: comment_class
comment_class.summary: Filters the returned CSS classes for the current comment.

class.label: class
class.description: A comma-separated list of additional classes added to the list.

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post ID or WP_Post object.

comment_cookie_lifetime.name: comment_cookie_lifetime
comment_cookie_lifetime.summary: Filters the lifetime of the comment cookie in seconds.

comment_edit_pre.name: comment_edit_pre
comment_edit_pre.summary: Filters the comment content before editing.

comment_edit_redirect.name: comment_edit_redirect
comment_edit_redirect.summary: Filters the URI the user is redirected to after editing a comment in the admin.

location.label: location
location.description: The URI the user will be redirected to.

comment_id.label: comment_id
comment_id.description: The ID of the comment being edited.

comment_email.name: comment_email
comment_email.summary: Filters the comment author's email for display.
comment_email.description: Care should be taken to protect the email address and assure that email harvesters do not capture your commenter's email address.

comment_excerpt.name: comment_excerpt
comment_excerpt.summary: Filters the comment excerpt for display.

comment_excerpt_length.name: comment_excerpt_length
comment_excerpt_length.summary: Filters the amount of words used in the comment excerpt.

comment_excerpt_length.label: comment_excerpt_length
comment_excerpt_length.description: The amount of words you want to display in the comment excerpt.

bool.label: bool
bool.description: Whether a comment flood is occurring. Default false.

time_lastcomment.label: time_lastcomment
time_lastcomment.description: Timestamp of when the last comment was posted.

time_newcomment.label: time_newcomment
time_newcomment.description: Timestamp of when the new comment was posted.

comment_form_default_fields.name: comment_form_default_fields
comment_form_default_fields.summary: Filters the default comment form fields.

fields.label: fields

customize_allowed_urls.name: customize_allowed_urls

customize_changeset_branching.name: customize_changeset_branching
customize_changeset_branching.summary: Filters whether or not changeset branching is allowed.
customize_changeset_branching.description:
By default in core, when changeset branching is not allowed, changesets will operate linearly in that only one saved changeset will exist at a time (with a 'draft' or 'future' status). This makes the Customizer operate in a way that is similar to going to "edit" to one existing post: all users will be making changes to the same post, and autosave revisions will be made for that post.

By contrast, when changeset branching is allowed, then the model is like users going to "add new" for a page and each user makes changes independently of each other since they are all operating on their own separate pages, each getting their own separate initial auto-drafts and then once initially saved, autosave revisions on top of that user's specific post.

Since linear changesets are deemed to be more suitable for the majority of WordPress users, they are the default. For WordPress sites that have heavy site management in the Customizer by multiple users then branching changesets should be enabled by means of this filter.

allow_branching.label: allow_branching
allow_branching.description: Whether branching is allowed. If false, the default, then only one saved changeset exists at a time.

data.description: Updated changeset data, mapping setting IDs to arrays containing a $value item and optionally other metadata.

context.label: context
context.description:
Filter context.
  • 'uuid'
    (string) Changeset UUID.
  • 'title'
    (string) Requested title for the changeset post.
  • 'status'
    (string) Requested status for the changeset post.
  • 'date_gmt'
    (string) Requested date for the changeset post in MySQL format and GMT timezone.
  • 'post_id'
    (int|false) Post ID for the changeset, or false if it doesn't exist yet.
  • 'previous_data'
    (array) Previous data contained in the changeset.
  • 'manager'
    (WP_Customize_Manager) Manager instance.

customize_render_partials_response.name: customize_render_partials_response
customize_render_partials_response.summary: Filters the response from rendering the partials.
customize_render_partials_response.description:
Plugins may use this filter to inject $scripts and $styles, which are dependencies for the partials being rendered. The response data will be available to the client via the render-partials-response JS event, so the client can then inject the scripts and styles into the DOM if they have not already been enqueued there.

If plugins do this, they'll need to take care for any scripts that do document.write() and make sure that these are not injected, or else to override the function to no-op, or else the page will be destroyed.

Plugins should be aware that $scripts and $styles may eventually be included by default in the response.

response.description:
Response.
  • 'contents'
    (array) Associative array mapping a partial ID its corresponding array of contents for the containers requested.
  • 'errors'
    (array) List of errors triggered during rendering of partials, if WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY is enabled.

default_hidden_meta_boxes.name: default_hidden_meta_boxes
default_hidden_meta_boxes.summary: Filters the default list of hidden meta boxes.

hidden.label: hidden
hidden.description: An array of meta boxes hidden by default.

screen.label: screen
screen.description: WP_Screen object of the current screen.

default_option_option.name: default_option_{$option}
default_option_option.summary: Filters the default value for an option.
default_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

default.label: default
default.description: The default value to return if the option does not exist in the database.

passed_default.label: passed_default
passed_default.description: Was get_option() passed a default value?

default_page_template_title.name: default_page_template_title
default_page_template_title.summary: Filters the title of the default page template displayed in the drop-down.

label.label: label
label.description: The display value for the default page template title.

context.label: context
context.description: Where the option label is displayed. Possible values include 'meta-box' or 'quick-edit'.

default_site_option_option.name: default_site_option_{$option}
default_site_option_option.summary: Filters a specific default network option.
default_site_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

default.label: default
default.description: The value to return if the site option does not exist in the database.

default_title.name: default_title
default_title.summary: Filters the default post title initially used in the "Write Post" form.

delete_meta_type_metadata.name: delete_{$meta_type}_metadata
delete_meta_type_metadata.summary: Filters whether to delete metadata of a specific type.
delete_meta_type_metadata.description: The dynamic portion of the hook, $meta_type, refers to the meta object type (comment, post, term, or user). Returning a non-null value will effectively short-circuit the function.

delete.label: delete
delete.description: Whether to allow metadata deletion of the given type.

meta_value.label: meta_value
meta_value.description: Meta value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.

delete_all.label: delete_all
delete_all.description: Whether to delete the matching metadata entries for all objects, ignoring the specified $object_id. Default false.

delete_meta_type_metadata_by_mid.name: delete_{$meta_type}_metadata_by_mid
delete_meta_type_metadata_by_mid.summary: Filters whether to delete metadata of a specific type by meta ID.
delete_meta_type_metadata_by_mid.description: The dynamic portion of the hook, $meta_type, refers to the meta object type (comment, post, term, or user). Returning a non-null value will effectively short-circuit the function.

delete.label: delete
delete.description: Whether to allow metadata deletion of the given type.

delete_site_email_content.name: delete_site_email_content
delete_site_email_content.summary: Filters the email content sent when a site in a Multisite network is deleted.

content.label: content
content.description: The email content that will be sent to the user who deleted a site in a Multisite network.

deprecated_argument_trigger_error.name: deprecated_argument_trigger_error
deprecated_argument_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger an error for deprecated arguments.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger the error for deprecated arguments. Default true.

deprecated_constructor_trigger_error.name: deprecated_constructor_trigger_error
deprecated_constructor_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger an error for deprecated functions.
deprecated_constructor_trigger_error.description: WP_DEBUG must be true in addition to the filter evaluating to true.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger the error for deprecated functions. Default true.

deprecated_file_trigger_error.name: deprecated_file_trigger_error
deprecated_file_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger an error for deprecated files.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger the error for deprecated files. Default true.

deprecated_function_trigger_error.name: deprecated_function_trigger_error
deprecated_function_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger an error for deprecated functions.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger the error for deprecated functions. Default true.

deprecated_hook_trigger_error.name: deprecated_hook_trigger_error
deprecated_hook_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger deprecated hook errors.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger deprecated hook errors. Requires WP_DEBUG to be defined true.

determine_current_user.name: determine_current_user
determine_current_user.description:
The default filters use this to determine the current user from the request's cookies, if available.

Returning a value of false will effectively short-circuit setting the current user.

user_id.label: user_id
user_id.description: User ID if one has been determined, false otherwise.

determine_locale.name: determine_locale
determine_locale.summary: Filters the locale for the current request.

disable_captions.name: disable_captions
disable_captions.description: Prevents image captions from being appended to image HTML when inserted into the editor.

bool.label: bool
bool.description: Whether to disable appending captions. Returning true to the filter will disable captions. Default empty string.

disable_categories_dropdown.name: disable_categories_dropdown
disable_categories_dropdown.summary: Filters whether to remove the 'Categories' drop-down from the post list table.

disable.label: disable
disable.description: Whether to disable the categories drop-down. Default false.

disable_months_dropdown.name: disable_months_dropdown
disable_months_dropdown.summary: Filters whether to remove the 'Months' drop-down from the post list table.

disable.label: disable
disable.description: Whether to disable the drop-down. Default false.

display_media_states.name: display_media_states
display_media_states.summary: Filters the default media display states for items in the Media list table.

media_states.label: media_states
media_states.description: An array of media states. Default 'Header Image', 'Background Image', 'Site Icon', 'Logo'.

display_post_states.name: display_post_states
display_post_states.summary: Filters the default post display states used in the posts list table.

post_states.label: post_states
post_states.description: An array of post display states.

do_parse_request.name: do_parse_request
do_parse_request.summary: Filters whether to parse the request.

bool.label: bool
bool.description: Whether or not to parse the request. Default true.

do_shortcode_tag.name: do_shortcode_tag
do_shortcode_tag.summary: Filters the output created by a shortcode callback.

attr.label: attr
attr.description: Shortcode attributes array or empty string.

document_title_parts.name: document_title_parts
document_title_parts.summary: Filters the parts of the document title.

title.label: title
title.description:
The document title parts.
  • 'title'
    (string) Title of the viewed page.
  • 'page'
    (string) Optional. Page number if paginated.
  • 'tagline'
    (string) Optional. Site description when on home page.
  • 'site'
    (string) Optional. Site title when not on home page.

document_title_separator.name: document_title_separator
document_title_separator.summary: Filters the separator for the document title.

documentation_ignore_functions.name: documentation_ignore_functions
documentation_ignore_functions.summary: Filters the list of functions and classes to be ignored from the documentation lookup.

ignore_functions.label: ignore_functions
ignore_functions.description: Array of names of functions and classes to be ignored.

doing_it_wrong_trigger_error.name: doing_it_wrong_trigger_error
doing_it_wrong_trigger_error.summary: Filters whether to trigger an error for _doing_it_wrong() calls.

trigger.label: trigger
trigger.description: Whether to trigger the error for _doing_it_wrong() calls. Default true.

message.label: message
message.description: A message explaining what has been done incorrectly.

version.label: version
version.description: The version of WordPress where the message was added.

domain_exists.name: domain_exists
domain_exists.summary: Filters whether a site name is taken.
domain_exists.description: The name is the site's subdomain or the site's subdirectory path depending on the network settings.

result.label: result
result.description: The site ID if the site name exists, null otherwise.

network_id.label: network_id
network_id.description: Network ID. Relevant only on multi-network installations.

download_url_error_max_body_size.name: download_url_error_max_body_size
download_url_error_max_body_size.summary: Filters the maximum error response body size in `download_url()`.

size.label: size
size.description: The maximum error response body size. Default 1 KB.

duplicate_comment_id.name: duplicate_comment_id
duplicate_comment_id.summary: Filters the ID, if any, of the duplicate comment found when creating a new comment.
duplicate_comment_id.description: Return an empty value from this filter to allow what WP considers a duplicate comment.

dupe_id.label: dupe_id
dupe_id.description: ID of the comment identified as a duplicate.

commentdata.label: commentdata
commentdata.description: Data for the comment being created.

dynamic_sidebar_has_widgets.name: dynamic_sidebar_has_widgets
dynamic_sidebar_has_widgets.summary: Filters whether a sidebar has widgets.
dynamic_sidebar_has_widgets.description: Note: The filter is also evaluated for empty sidebars, and on both the front end and back end, including the Inactive Widgets sidebar on the Widgets screen.

did_one.label: did_one
did_one.description: Whether at least one widget was rendered in the sidebar. Default false.

index.label: index
index.description: Index, name, or ID of the dynamic sidebar.

dynamic_sidebar_params.name: dynamic_sidebar_params
dynamic_sidebar_params.summary: Filters the parameters passed to a widget's display callback.
dynamic_sidebar_params.description: Note: The filter is evaluated on both the front end and back end, including for the Inactive Widgets sidebar on the Widgets screen.

params.label: params
params.description:
• 'args'
    (array) An array of widget display arguments.
    • 'name'
      (string) Name of the sidebar the widget is assigned to.
    • 'id'
      (string) ID of the sidebar the widget is assigned to.
    • 'description'
      (string) The sidebar description.
    • 'class'
      (string) CSS class applied to the sidebar container.
    • 'before_widget'
      (string) HTML markup to prepend to each widget in the sidebar.
    • 'after_widget'
      (string) HTML markup to append to each widget in the sidebar.
    • 'before_title'
      (string) HTML markup to prepend to the widget title when displayed.
    • 'after_title'
      (string) HTML markup to append to the widget title when displayed.
    • 'widget_id'
      (string) ID of the widget.
    • 'widget_name'
      (string) Name of the widget.
  • 'widget_args'
    (array) An array of multi-widget arguments.
    • 'number'
      (int) Number increment used for multiples of the same widget.

edit_bookmark_link.name: edit_bookmark_link
edit_bookmark_link.summary: Filters the bookmark edit link anchor tag.

link.label: link
link.description: Anchor tag for the edit link.

edit_categories_per_page.name: edit_categories_per_page
edit_categories_per_page.summary: Filters the number of terms displayed per page for the Categories list table.

tags_per_page.label: tags_per_page
tags_per_page.description: Number of categories to be displayed. Default 20.

edit_comment_link.name: edit_comment_link
edit_comment_link.summary: Filters the comment edit link anchor tag.

link.label: link
link.description: Anchor tag for the edit link.

edit_comment_misc_actions.name: edit_comment_misc_actions
edit_comment_misc_actions.summary: Filters miscellaneous actions for the edit comment form sidebar.

html.label: html
html.description: Output HTML to display miscellaneous action.

edit_field.name: edit_{$field}
edit_field.summary: Filters the value of a specific post field to edit.
edit_field.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $field, refers to the post field name.

edit_post_link.name: edit_post_link
edit_post_link.summary: Filters the post edit link anchor tag.

link.label: link
link.description: Anchor tag for the edit link.

edit_post_type_per_page.name: edit_{$post_type}_per_page
edit_post_type_per_page.summary: Filters the number of items per page to show for a specific 'per_page' type.
edit_post_type_per_page.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $post_type, refers to the post type.

Some examples of filter hooks generated here include: 'edit_attachment_per_page', 'edit_post_per_page', 'edit_page_per_page', etc.

posts_per_page.label: posts_per_page
posts_per_page.description: Number of posts to display per page for the given post type. Default 20.

edit_posts_per_page.name: edit_posts_per_page
edit_posts_per_page.summary: Filters the number of posts displayed per page when specifically listing "posts".

posts_per_page.label: posts_per_page
posts_per_page.description: Number of posts to be displayed. Default 20.

edit_profile_url.name: edit_profile_url
edit_profile_url.summary: Filters the URL for a user's profile editor.

url.label: url
url.description: The complete URL including scheme and path.

scheme.label: scheme
scheme.description: Scheme to give the URL context. Accepts 'http', 'https', 'login', 'login_post', 'admin', 'relative' or null.

edit_tag_link.name: edit_tag_link
edit_tag_link.summary: Filters the anchor tag for the edit link for a tag (or term in another taxonomy).

link.label: link
link.description: The anchor tag for the edit link.

edit_tags_per_page.name: edit_tags_per_page
edit_tags_per_page.summary: Filters the number of terms displayed per page for the Tags list table.

tags_per_page.label: tags_per_page
tags_per_page.description: Number of tags to be displayed. Default 20.

edit_taxonomy_field.name: edit_{$taxonomy}_{$field}
edit_taxonomy_field.summary: Filters the taxonomy field to edit before it is sanitized.
edit_taxonomy_field.description: The dynamic portions of the filter name, $taxonomy and $field, refer to the taxonomy slug and taxonomy field, respectively.

value.label: value
value.description: Value of the taxonomy field to edit.

edit_term_field.name: edit_term_{$field}
edit_term_field.summary: Filters a term field to edit before it is sanitized.
edit_term_field.description: The dynamic portion of the filter name, $field, refers to the term field.

edit_term_link.name: edit_term_link
edit_term_link.summary: Filters the anchor tag for the edit link of a term.

link.label: link
link.description: The anchor tag for the edit link.

edit_user_field.name: edit_user_{$field}
edit_user_field.summary: Filters a user field value in the 'edit' context.
edit_user_field.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $field, refers to the prefixed user field being filtered, such as 'user_login', 'user_email', 'first_name', etc.

value.label: value
value.description: Value of the prefixed user field.

editable_extensions.name: editable_extensions
editable_extensions.summary: Filters file type extensions editable in the plugin editor.

editable_extensions.label: editable_extensions
editable_extensions.description: An array of editable plugin file extensions.

plugin.label: plugin
plugin.description: Path to the plugin file relative to the plugins directory.

editable_roles.name: editable_roles
editable_roles.summary: Filters the list of editable roles.

all_roles.label: all_roles
all_roles.description: Array of arrays containing role information.

editable_slug.name: editable_slug
editable_slug.description: Note: This is a multi-use hook in that it is leveraged both for editable post URIs and term slugs.

slug.label: slug
slug.description: The editable slug. Will be either a term slug or post URI depending upon the context in which it is evaluated.

editor_max_image_size.name: editor_max_image_size
editor_max_image_size.summary: Filters the maximum image size dimensions for the editor.

max_image_size.label: max_image_size
max_image_size.description: An array with the width as the first element, and the height as the second element.

size.label: size
size.description: Size of what the result image should be.

context.label: context
context.description: The context the image is being resized for. Possible values are 'display' (like in a theme) or 'edit' (like inserting into an editor).

editor_stylesheets.name: editor_stylesheets
editor_stylesheets.summary: Filters the array of stylesheets applied to the editor.

stylesheets.label: stylesheets
stylesheets.description: Array of stylesheets to be applied to the editor.

email_change_email.name: email_change_email
email_change_email.summary: Filters the contents of the email sent when the user's email is changed.

email_change_email.label: email_change_email
email_change_email.description:
Used to build wp_mail().
  • 'to'
    (string) The intended recipients.
  • 'subject'
    (string) The subject of the email.
  • 'message'
    (string) The content of the email. The following strings have a special meaning and will get replaced dynamically: - ###USERNAME### The current user's username. - ###ADMIN_EMAIL### The admin email in case this was unexpected. - ###NEW_EMAIL### The new email address. - ###EMAIL### The old email address. - ###SITENAME### The name of the site. - ###SITEURL### The URL to the site.
  • 'headers'
    (string) Headers.

embed_cache_oembed_types.name: embed_cache_oembed_types
embed_cache_oembed_types.summary: Filters the array of post types to cache oEmbed results for.

post_types.label: post_types
post_types.description: Array of post type names to cache oEmbed results for. Defaults to post types with show_ui set to true.

embed_defaults.name: embed_defaults
embed_defaults.summary: Filters the default array of embed dimensions.

size.label: size
size.description: An array of embed width and height values in pixels (in that order).

url.label: url
url.description: The URL that should be embedded.

return.label: return
return.description: The shortcode callback function to call.

embed_html.name: embed_html
embed_html.summary: Filters the embed HTML output for a given post.

output.label: output
output.description: The default iframe tag to display embedded content.

embed_maybe_make_link.name: embed_maybe_make_link
embed_maybe_make_link.summary: Filters the returned, maybe-linked embed URL.

embed_oembed_discover.name: embed_oembed_discover
embed_oembed_discover.summary: Filters whether to inspect the given URL for discoverable link tags.

enable.label: enable
enable.description: Whether to enable <link> tag discovery. Default true.

cache.label: cache
cache.description: The cached HTML result, stored in post meta.

embed_site_title_html.name: embed_site_title_html
embed_site_title_html.summary: Filters the site title HTML in the embed footer.

embed_thumbnail_id.name: embed_thumbnail_id
embed_thumbnail_id.summary: Filters the thumbnail image ID for use in the embed template.

embed_thumbnail_image_shape.name: embed_thumbnail_image_shape
embed_thumbnail_image_shape.summary: Filters the thumbnail shape for use in the embed template.
embed_thumbnail_image_shape.description: Rectangular images are shown above the title while square images are shown next to the content.

embed_thumbnail_image_size.name: embed_thumbnail_image_size
embed_thumbnail_image_size.summary: Filters the thumbnail image size for use in the embed template.

emoji_ext.name: emoji_ext
emoji_ext.summary: Filters the extension of the emoji png files.

outputs.description: The emoji extension for png files. Default .png.

emoji_svg_ext.name: emoji_svg_ext
emoji_svg_ext.summary: Filters the extension of the emoji SVG files.

outputs.description: The emoji extension for svg files. Default .svg.

emoji_svg_url.name: emoji_svg_url
emoji_svg_url.summary: Filters the URL where emoji SVG images are hosted.

outputs.description: The emoji base URL for svg images.

emoji_url.name: emoji_url
emoji_url.summary: Filters the URL where emoji png images are hosted.

outputs.description: The emoji base URL for png images.

enable_edit_any_user_configuration.name: enable_edit_any_user_configuration
enable_edit_any_user_configuration.summary: Filters whether to allow administrators on Multisite to edit every user.
enable_edit_any_user_configuration.description:
Enabling the user editing form via this filter also hinges on the user holding the 'manage_network_users' cap, and the logged-in user not matching the user profile open for editing.

The filter was introduced to replace the EDIT_ANY_USER constant.

allow.label: allow
allow.description: Whether to allow editing of any user. Default true.

enable_live_network_counts.name: enable_live_network_counts
enable_live_network_counts.summary: Filters whether to update network site or user counts when a new site is created.

small_network.label: small_network
small_network.description: Whether the network is considered small.

context.label: context
context.description: Context. Either 'users' or 'sites'.

enable_loading_advanced_cache_dropin.name: enable_loading_advanced_cache_dropin
enable_loading_advanced_cache_dropin.summary: Filters whether to enable loading of the advanced-cache.php drop-in.
enable_loading_advanced_cache_dropin.description: This filter runs before it can be used by plugins. It is designed for non-web run-times. If false is returned, advanced-cache.php will never be loaded.

enable_advanced_cache.label: enable_advanced_cache
enable_advanced_cache.description: Whether to enable loading advanced-cache.php (if present). Default true.

enable_login_autofocus.name: enable_login_autofocus
enable_login_autofocus.summary: Filters whether to print the call to `wp_attempt_focus()` on the login screen.

print.label: print
print.description: Whether to print the function call. Default true.

enable_maintenance_mode.name: enable_maintenance_mode
enable_maintenance_mode.summary: Filters whether to enable maintenance mode.
enable_maintenance_mode.description: This filter runs before it can be used by plugins. It is designed for non-web runtimes. If this filter returns true, maintenance mode will be active and the request will end. If false, the request will be allowed to continue processing even if maintenance mode should be active.

enable_checks.label: enable_checks
enable_checks.description: Whether to enable maintenance mode. Default true.

upgrading.label: upgrading
upgrading.description: The timestamp set in the .maintenance file.

enable_post_by_email_configuration.name: enable_post_by_email_configuration
enable_post_by_email_configuration.summary: Filters whether the post-by-email functionality is enabled.

enabled.label: enabled
enabled.description: Whether post-by-email configuration is enabled. Default true.

enable_update_services_configuration.name: enable_update_services_configuration
enable_update_services_configuration.summary: Filters whether to enable the Update Services section in the Writing settings screen.

enable.label: enable
enable.description: Whether to enable the Update Services settings area. Default true.

enable_wp_debug_mode_checks.name: enable_wp_debug_mode_checks
enable_wp_debug_mode_checks.summary: Filters whether to allow the debug mode check to occur.
enable_wp_debug_mode_checks.description: This filter runs before it can be used by plugins. It is designed for non-web run-times. Returning false causes the WP_DEBUG and related constants to not be checked and the default php values for errors will be used unless you take care to update them yourself.

enable_debug_mode.label: enable_debug_mode
enable_debug_mode.description: Whether to enable debug mode checks to occur. Default true.

enclosure_links.name: enclosure_links
enclosure_links.summary: Filters the list of enclosure links before querying the database.
enclosure_links.description: Allows for the addition and/or removal of potential enclosures to save to postmeta before checking the database for existing enclosures.

enter_title_here.name: enter_title_here
enter_title_here.summary: Filters the title field placeholder text.

esc_html.name: esc_html
esc_html.summary: Filters a string cleaned and escaped for output in HTML.
esc_html.description: Text passed to esc_html() is stripped of invalid or special characters before output.

safe_text.label: safe_text
safe_text.description: The text after it has been escaped.

text.label: text
text.description: The text prior to being escaped.

esc_textarea.name: esc_textarea
esc_textarea.summary: Filters a string cleaned and escaped for output in a textarea element.

safe_text.label: safe_text
safe_text.description: The text after it has been escaped.

text.label: text
text.description: The text prior to being escaped.

excerpt_allowed_blocks.name: excerpt_allowed_blocks
excerpt_allowed_blocks.summary: Filters the list of blocks that can contribute to the excerpt.
excerpt_allowed_blocks.description: If a dynamic block is added to this list, it must not generate another excerpt, as this will cause an infinite loop to occur.

excerpt_length.name: excerpt_length
excerpt_length.summary: Filters the number of words in an excerpt.

excerpt_more.name: excerpt_more
excerpt_more.summary: Filters the string in the "more" link displayed after a trimmed excerpt.

more_string.label: more_string
more_string.description: The string shown within the more link.

exit_on_http_head.name: exit_on_http_head
exit_on_http_head.summary: Filters whether to allow 'HEAD' requests to generate content.
exit_on_http_head.description: Provides a significant performance bump by exiting before the page content loads for 'HEAD' requests. See #14348.

exit.label: exit
exit.description: Whether to exit without generating any content for 'HEAD' requests. Default true.

expiration_of_site_transient_transient.name: expiration_of_site_transient_{$transient}
expiration_of_site_transient_transient.summary: Filters the expiration for a site transient before its value is set.
expiration_of_site_transient_transient.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

expiration.label: expiration
expiration.description: Time until expiration in seconds. Use 0 for no expiration.

expiration_of_transient_transient.name: expiration_of_transient_{$transient}
expiration_of_transient_transient.summary: Filters the expiration for a transient before its value is set.
expiration_of_transient_transient.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

expiration.label: expiration
expiration.description: Time until expiration in seconds. Use 0 for no expiration.

args.label: args
args.description: The arguments to send to the exporter.

wp_filename.label: wp_filename
wp_filename.description: The name of the file for download.

ext2type.name: ext2type
ext2type.summary: Filters file type based on the extension name.

ext2type.label: ext2type
ext2type.description: Multi-dimensional array with extensions for a default set of file types.

extra_context_headers.name: extra_{$context}_headers
extra_context_headers.summary: Filters extra file headers by context.
extra_context_headers.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $context, refers to the context where extra headers might be loaded.

fallback_intermediate_image_sizes.name: fallback_intermediate_image_sizes
fallback_intermediate_image_sizes.summary: Filters the image sizes generated for non-image mime types.

fallback_sizes.label: fallback_sizes
fallback_sizes.description: An array of image size names.

feed_content_type.name: feed_content_type
feed_content_type.summary: Filters the content type for a specific feed type.

content_type.label: content_type
content_type.description: Content type indicating the type of data that a feed contains.

type.label: type
type.description: Type of feed. Possible values include 'rss', rss2', 'atom', and 'rdf'.

feed_links_show_comments_feed.name: feed_links_show_comments_feed
feed_links_show_comments_feed.summary: Filters whether to display the comments feed link.

show.label: show
show.description: Whether to display the comments feed link. Default true.

feed_links_show_posts_feed.name: feed_links_show_posts_feed
feed_links_show_posts_feed.summary: Filters whether to display the posts feed link.

show.label: show
show.description: Whether to display the posts feed link. Default true.

field.name: {$field}
field.summary: Filters the value of a specific post field for display.
field.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $field, refers to the post field name.

value.label: value
value.description: Value of the prefixed post field.

Arguments used to calculate pagination. These include arguments auto-detected by the function, based on query vars, system settings, etc. For pristine arguments passed to the function, see $original_args.
  • 'type'
    (string) Type of comments to count.
  • 'page'
    (int) Calculated current page.
  • 'per_page'
    (int) Calculated number of comments per page.
  • 'max_depth'
    (int) Maximum comment threading depth allowed.

Array of arguments passed to the function. Some or all of these may not be set.
  • 'type'
    (string) Type of comments to count.
  • 'page'
    (int) Current comment page.
  • 'per_page'
    (int) Number of comments per page.
  • 'max_depth'
    (int) Maximum comment threading depth allowed.
