link.description: The complete anchor tag for the comment feed link.

feed.label: feed
feed.description: The feed type, or an empty string for the default feed type.

post_comments_link.name: post_comments_link
post_comments_link.summary: Filters the formatted post comments link HTML.

post.label: post
post.description: The post ID or WP_Post object.

post_date_column_status.name: post_date_column_status
post_date_column_status.summary: Filters the status text of the post.

post_date_column_time.name: post_date_column_time
post_date_column_time.summary: Filters the published time of the post.
post_date_column_time.description: If $mode equals 'excerpt', the published time and date are both displayed. If $mode equals 'list' (default), the publish date is displayed, with the time and date together available as an abbreviation definition.

post_edit_category_parent_dropdown_args.name: post_edit_category_parent_dropdown_args
post_edit_category_parent_dropdown_args.summary: Filters the arguments for the taxonomy parent dropdown on the Post Edit page.

parent_dropdown_args.label: parent_dropdown_args
parent_dropdown_args.description:
Array of arguments to generate parent dropdown.
  • 'taxonomy'
    (string) Name of the taxonomy to retrieve.
  • 'hide_if_empty'
    (bool) True to skip generating markup if no categories are found. Default 0.
  • 'name'
    (string) Value for the 'name' attribute of the select element. Default "new{$tax_name}_parent".
  • 'orderby'
    (string) Which column to use for ordering terms. Default 'name'.
  • 'hierarchical'
    (bool|int) Whether to traverse the taxonomy hierarchy. Default 1.
  • 'show_option_none'
    (string) Text to display for the "none" option. Default "— {$parent} —", where $parent is 'parent_item' taxonomy label.

post_embed_url.name: post_embed_url
post_embed_url.summary: Filters the URL to embed a specific post.

post_format_rewrite_base.name: post_format_rewrite_base
post_format_rewrite_base.summary: Filters the post formats rewrite base.

context.label: context
context.description: Context of the rewrite base. Default 'type'.

post_gallery.name: post_gallery
post_gallery.summary: Filters the default gallery shortcode output.
post_gallery.description: If the filtered output isn't empty, it will be used instead of generating the default gallery template.

instance.label: instance
instance.description: Unique numeric ID of this gallery shortcode instance.

post_link.name: post_link
post_link.summary: Filters the permalink for a post.
post_link.description: Only applies to posts with post_type of 'post'.

leavename.label: leavename
leavename.description: Whether to keep the post name.

post_link_category.name: post_link_category
post_link_category.summary: Filters the category that gets used in the %category% permalink token.

cat.label: cat
cat.description: The category to use in the permalink.

cats.label: cats
cats.description: Array of all categories (WP_Term objects) associated with the post.

post_mime_types.name: post_mime_types
post_mime_types.summary: Filters the default list of post mime types.

post_mime_types.label: post_mime_types
post_mime_types.description: Default list of post mime types.

post_password_expires.name: post_password_expires
post_password_expires.summary: Filters the life span of the post password cookie.
post_password_expires.description: By default, the cookie expires 10 days from creation. To turn this into a session cookie, return 0.

expires.label: expires
expires.description: The expiry time, as passed to setcookie().

post_password_required.name: post_password_required
post_password_required.summary: Filters whether a post requires the user to supply a password.

required.label: required
required.description: Whether the user needs to supply a password. True if password has not been provided or is incorrect, false if password has been supplied or is not required.

post_playlist.name: post_playlist
post_playlist.description: Passing a non-empty value to the filter will short-circuit generation of the default playlist output, returning the passed value instead.

instance.label: instance
instance.description: Unique numeric ID of this playlist shortcode instance.

post_rewrite_rules.name: post_rewrite_rules
post_rewrite_rules.summary: Filters rewrite rules used for "post" archives.

post_row_actions.name: post_row_actions
post_row_actions.summary: Filters the array of row action links on the Posts list table.
post_row_actions.description: The filter is evaluated only for non-hierarchical post types.

actions.label: actions
actions.description: An array of row action links. Defaults are 'Edit', 'Quick Edit', 'Restore', 'Trash', 'Delete Permanently', 'Preview', and 'View'.

size.label: size
size.description: The post thumbnail size. Image size or array of width and height values (in that order). Default 'post-thumbnail'.

size.label: size
size.description: The post thumbnail size. Image size or array of width and height values (in that order). Default 'post-thumbnail'.

post_type_archive_feed_link.name: post_type_archive_feed_link
post_type_archive_feed_link.summary: Filters the post type archive feed link.

link.label: link
link.description: The post type archive feed link.

post_type_archive_link.name: post_type_archive_link
post_type_archive_link.summary: Filters the post type archive permalink.

post_type_archive_title.name: post_type_archive_title
post_type_archive_title.summary: Filters the post type archive title.

post_type_labels_post_type.name: post_type_labels_{$post_type}
post_type_labels_post_type.summary: Filters the labels of a specific post type.
post_type_labels_post_type.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $post_type, refers to the post type slug.

labels.label: labels
labels.description: Object with labels for the post type as member variables.

post_type_link.name: post_type_link
post_type_link.summary: Filters the permalink for a post of a custom post type.

leavename.label: leavename
leavename.description: Whether to keep the post name.

post_types_to_delete_with_user.name: post_types_to_delete_with_user
post_types_to_delete_with_user.summary: Filters the list of post types to delete with a user.

post_types_to_delete.label: post_types_to_delete
post_types_to_delete.description: Array of post types to delete.

messages.label: messages
messages.description: Post updated messages. For defaults see $messages declarations above.

postbox_classes_page_id.name: postbox_classes_{$page}_{$id}
postbox_classes_page_id.summary: Filters the postbox classes for a specific screen and screen ID combo.
postbox_classes_page_id.description: The dynamic portions of the hook name, $page and $id, refer to the screen and screen ID, respectively.

postmeta_form_keys.name: postmeta_form_keys
postmeta_form_keys.summary: Filters values for the meta key dropdown in the Custom Fields meta box.
postmeta_form_keys.description: Returning a non-null value will effectively short-circuit and avoid a potentially expensive query against postmeta.

keys.label: keys
keys.description: Pre-defined meta keys to be used in place of a postmeta query. Default null.

postmeta_form_limit.name: postmeta_form_limit
postmeta_form_limit.summary: Filters the number of custom fields to retrieve for the drop-down in the Custom Fields meta box.

limit.label: limit
limit.description: Number of custom fields to retrieve. Default 30.

posts_request_ids.name: posts_request_ids
posts_request_ids.summary: Filters the Post IDs SQL request before sending.

request.label: request
request.description: The post ID request.

posts_search_orderby.name: posts_search_orderby
posts_search_orderby.summary: Filters the ORDER BY used when ordering search results.

pre_add_site_option_option.name: pre_add_site_option_{$option}
pre_add_site_option_option.summary: Filters the value of a specific network option before it is added.
pre_add_site_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

pre_cache_alloptions.name: pre_cache_alloptions
pre_cache_alloptions.summary: Filters all options before caching them.

pre_category_nicename.name: pre_category_nicename
pre_category_nicename.summary: Filters the category nicename before it is sanitized.

pre_clear_scheduled_hook.name: pre_clear_scheduled_hook
pre_clear_scheduled_hook.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack clearing a scheduled hook.
pre_clear_scheduled_hook.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit the normal unscheduling process, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, return the number of events successfully unscheduled (zero if no events were registered with the hook) or false if unscheduling one or more events fails.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue unscheduling the event.

hook.label: hook
hook.description: Action hook, the execution of which will be unscheduled.

args.label: args
args.description: Arguments to pass to the hook's callback function.

pre_comment_approved.name: pre_comment_approved
pre_comment_approved.summary: Filters a comment's approval status before it is set.

approved.label: approved
approved.description: The approval status. Accepts 1, 0, 'spam' or WP_Error.

pre_comment_author_email.name: pre_comment_author_email
pre_comment_author_email.summary: Filters the comment author's email cookie before it is set.
pre_comment_author_email.description: When this filter hook is evaluated in wp_filter_comment(), the comment author's email string is passed.

pre_comment_author_name.name: pre_comment_author_name
pre_comment_author_name.summary: Filters the comment author's name cookie before it is set.
pre_comment_author_name.description: When this filter hook is evaluated in wp_filter_comment(), the comment author's name string is passed.

pre_comment_author_url.name: pre_comment_author_url
pre_comment_author_url.summary: Filters the comment author's URL cookie before it is set.
pre_comment_author_url.description: When this filter hook is evaluated in wp_filter_comment(), the comment author's URL string is passed.

pre_comment_content.name: pre_comment_content
pre_comment_content.summary: Filters the comment content before it is set.

pre_comment_user_agent.name: pre_comment_user_agent
pre_comment_user_agent.summary: Filters the comment author's browser user agent before it is set.

comment_agent.label: comment_agent
comment_agent.description: The comment author's browser user agent.

pre_comment_user_ip.name: pre_comment_user_ip
pre_comment_user_ip.summary: Filters the comment author's IP address before it is set.

pre_count_users.name: pre_count_users
pre_count_users.summary: Filter the user count before queries are run. Return a non-null value to cause count_users() to return early.

result.label: result
result.description: Default null.

strategy.label: strategy
strategy.description: The computational strategy to use when counting the users. Accepts either 'time' or 'memory'. Default 'time'.

site_id.label: site_id
site_id.description: The site ID to count users for. Defaults to the current site.

pre_delete_post.name: pre_delete_post
pre_delete_post.summary: Filters whether a post deletion should take place.

delete.label: delete
delete.description: Whether to go forward with deletion.

pre_determine_locale.name: pre_determine_locale
pre_determine_locale.summary: Filters the locale for the current request prior to the default determination process.
pre_determine_locale.description: Using this filter allows to override the default logic, effectively short-circuiting the function.

outputs.description: The locale to return and short-circuit, or null as default.

pre_do_shortcode_tag.name: pre_do_shortcode_tag
pre_do_shortcode_tag.summary: Filters whether to call a shortcode callback.
pre_do_shortcode_tag.description: Passing a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit the shortcode generation process, returning that value instead.

return.label: return
return.description: Short-circuit return value. Either false or the value to replace the shortcode with.

attr.label: attr
attr.description: Shortcode attributes array or empty string.

pre_ent2ncr.name: pre_ent2ncr
pre_ent2ncr.summary: Filters text before named entities are converted into numbered entities.
pre_ent2ncr.description: A non-null string must be returned for the filter to be evaluated.

converted_text.label: converted_text
converted_text.description: The text to be converted. Default null.

text.label: text
text.description: The text prior to entity conversion.

pre_field.name: pre_{$field}
pre_field.summary: Filters the value of a specific post field before saving.
pre_field.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $field, refers to the post field name.

pre_get_avatar.name: pre_get_avatar
pre_get_avatar.summary: Filters whether to retrieve the avatar URL early.
pre_get_avatar.description: Passing a non-null value will effectively short-circuit get_avatar(), passing the value through the {@see 'get_avatar'} filter and returning early.

avatar.label: avatar
avatar.description: HTML for the user's avatar. Default null.

id_or_email.label: id_or_email
id_or_email.description: The Gravatar to retrieve. Accepts a user_id, gravatar md5 hash, user email, WP_User object, WP_Post object, or WP_Comment object.

args.label: args
args.description: Arguments passed to get_avatar_url(), after processing.

pre_get_avatar_data.name: pre_get_avatar_data
pre_get_avatar_data.summary: Filters whether to retrieve the avatar URL early.
pre_get_avatar_data.description: Passing a non-null value in the 'url' member of the return array will effectively short circuit get_avatar_data(), passing the value through the {@see 'get_avatar_data'} filter and returning early.

args.label: args
args.description: Arguments passed to get_avatar_data(), after processing.

id_or_email.label: id_or_email
id_or_email.description: The Gravatar to retrieve. Accepts a user_id, gravatar md5 hash, user email, WP_User object, WP_Post object, or WP_Comment object.

pre_get_blogs_of_user.name: pre_get_blogs_of_user
pre_get_blogs_of_user.summary: Filters the list of a user's sites before it is populated.
pre_get_blogs_of_user.description: Passing a non-null value to the filter will effectively short circuit get_blogs_of_user(), returning that value instead.

sites.label: sites
sites.description: An array of site objects of which the user is a member.

all.label: all
all.description: Whether the returned array should contain all sites, including those marked 'deleted', 'archived', or 'spam'. Default false.

pre_get_col_charset.name: pre_get_col_charset
pre_get_col_charset.summary: Filters the column charset value before the DB is checked.
pre_get_col_charset.description: Passing a non-null value to the filter will short-circuit checking the DB for the charset, returning that value instead.

charset.label: charset
charset.description: The character set to use. Default null.

table.label: table
table.description: The name of the table being checked.

column.label: column
column.description: The name of the column being checked.

pre_get_document_title.name: pre_get_document_title
pre_get_document_title.summary: Filters the document title before it is generated.
pre_get_document_title.description: Passing a non-empty value will short-circuit wp_get_document_title(), returning that value instead.

title.label: title
title.description: The document title. Default empty string.

pre_get_lastpostmodified.name: pre_get_lastpostmodified
pre_get_lastpostmodified.summary: Pre-filter the return value of get_lastpostmodified() before the query is run.

lastpostmodified.label: lastpostmodified
lastpostmodified.description: Date the last post was modified. Returning anything other than false will short-circuit the function.

timezone.label: timezone
timezone.description: Location to use for getting the post modified date. See get_lastpostdate() for accepted $timezone values.

pre_get_main_site_id.name: pre_get_main_site_id
pre_get_main_site_id.description: Returning a positive integer will effectively short-circuit the function.

main_site_id.label: main_site_id
main_site_id.description: If a positive integer is returned, it is interpreted as the main site ID.

network.label: network
network.description: The network object for which the main site was detected.

pre_get_network_by_path.name: pre_get_network_by_path
pre_get_network_by_path.summary: Determine a network by its domain and path.
pre_get_network_by_path.description:
This allows one to short-circuit the default logic, perhaps by replacing it with a routine that is more optimal for your setup.

Return null to avoid the short-circuit. Return false if no network can be found at the requested domain and path. Otherwise, return an object from wp_get_network().

network.label: network
network.description: Network value to return by path.

segments.label: segments
segments.description: The suggested number of paths to consult. Default null, meaning the entire path was to be consulted.

paths.label: paths
paths.description: Array of paths to search for, based on $path and $segments.

pre_get_ready_cron_jobs.name: pre_get_ready_cron_jobs
pre_get_ready_cron_jobs.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack retrieving ready cron jobs.
pre_get_ready_cron_jobs.description: Returning an array will short-circuit the normal retrieval of ready cron jobs, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Array of ready cron tasks to return instead. Default null to continue using results from _get_cron_array().

pre_get_scheduled_event.name: pre_get_scheduled_event
pre_get_scheduled_event.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack retrieving a scheduled event.
pre_get_scheduled_event.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit the normal process, returning the filtered value instead.

Return false if the event does not exist, otherwise an event object should be returned.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue retrieving the event.

args.label: args
args.description: Array containing each separate argument to pass to the hook's callback function. Although not passed to a callback, these arguments are used to uniquely identify the event.

timestamp.label: timestamp
timestamp.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the event. Null to retrieve next scheduled event.

pre_get_shortlink.name: pre_get_shortlink
pre_get_shortlink.summary: Filters whether to preempt generating a shortlink for the given post.
pre_get_shortlink.description: Passing a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit the shortlink-generation process, returning that value instead.

return.label: return
return.description: Short-circuit return value. Either false or a URL string.

id.label: id
id.description: Post ID, or 0 for the current post.

context.label: context
context.description: The context for the link. One of 'post' or 'query',

allow_slugs.label: allow_slugs
allow_slugs.description: Whether to allow post slugs in the shortlink.

pre_get_site_by_path.name: pre_get_site_by_path
pre_get_site_by_path.summary: Determine a site by its domain and path.
pre_get_site_by_path.description:
This allows one to short-circuit the default logic, perhaps by replacing it with a routine that is more optimal for your setup.

Return null to avoid the short-circuit. Return false if no site can be found at the requested domain and path. Otherwise, return a site object.

site.label: site
site.description: Site value to return by path.

segments.label: segments
segments.description: The suggested number of paths to consult. Default null, meaning the entire path was to be consulted.

paths.label: paths
paths.description: The paths to search for, based on $path and $segments.

pre_get_space_used.name: pre_get_space_used
pre_get_space_used.summary: Filters the amount of storage space used by the current site.

space_used.label: space_used
space_used.description: The amount of used space, in megabytes. Default false.

pre_get_table_charset.name: pre_get_table_charset
pre_get_table_charset.summary: Filters the table charset value before the DB is checked.
pre_get_table_charset.description: Passing a non-null value to the filter will effectively short-circuit checking the DB for the charset, returning that value instead.

charset.label: charset
charset.description: The character set to use. Default null.

table.label: table
table.description: The name of the table being checked.

pre_handle_404.name: pre_handle_404
pre_handle_404.summary: Filters whether to short-circuit default header status handling.
pre_handle_404.description: Returning a non-false value from the filter will short-circuit the handling and return early.

preempt.label: preempt
preempt.description: Whether to short-circuit default header status handling. Default false.

pre_http_request.name: pre_http_request
pre_http_request.summary: Filters whether to preempt an HTTP request's return value.
pre_http_request.description:
Returning a non-false value from the filter will short-circuit the HTTP request and return early with that value. A filter should return either:

  • An array containing 'headers', 'body', 'response', 'cookies', and 'filename' elements
  • A WP_Error instance
  • boolean false (to avoid short-circuiting the response)

Returning any other value may result in unexpected behaviour.

preempt.label: preempt
preempt.description: Whether to preempt an HTTP request's return value. Default false.

pre_http_send_through_proxy.name: pre_http_send_through_proxy
pre_http_send_through_proxy.summary: Filters whether to preempt sending the request through the proxy server.
pre_http_send_through_proxy.description: Returning false will bypass the proxy; returning true will send the request through the proxy. Returning null bypasses the filter.

override.label: override
override.description: Whether to override the request result. Default null.

check.label: check
check.description: Associative array result of parsing the URI.

home.label: home
home.description: Associative array result of parsing the site URL.

pre_insert_term.name: pre_insert_term
pre_insert_term.summary: Filters a term before it is sanitized and inserted into the database.

term.label: term
term.description: The term to add or update.

pre_kses.name: pre_kses
pre_kses.summary: Filters content to be run through kses.

pre_load_script_translations.name: pre_load_script_translations
pre_load_script_translations.summary: Pre-filters script translations for the given file, script handle and text domain.
pre_load_script_translations.description: Returning a non-null value allows to override the default logic, effectively short-circuiting the function.

file.label: file
file.description: Path to the translation file to load. False if there isn't one.

handle.label: handle
handle.description: Name of the script to register a translation domain to.

pre_move_uploaded_file.name: pre_move_uploaded_file
pre_move_uploaded_file.summary: Filters whether to short-circuit moving the uploaded file after passing all checks.
pre_move_uploaded_file.description: If a non-null value is passed to the filter, moving the file and any related error reporting will be completely skipped.

move_new_file.label: move_new_file
move_new_file.description: If null (default) move the file after the upload.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of data for a single file.

type.label: type
type.description: File type.

pre_oembed_result.name: pre_oembed_result
pre_oembed_result.summary: Filters the oEmbed result before any HTTP requests are made.
pre_oembed_result.description:
This allows one to short-circuit the default logic, perhaps by replacing it with a routine that is more optimal for your setup.

Passing a non-null value to the filter will effectively short-circuit retrieval, returning the passed value instead.

result.label: result
result.description: The UNSANITIZED (and potentially unsafe) HTML that should be used to embed. Default null.

url.label: url
url.description: The URL to the content that should be attempted to be embedded.

args.label: args
args.description: Arguments, usually passed from a shortcode. Default empty.

pre_option_option.name: pre_option_{$option}
pre_option_option.summary: Filters the value of an existing option before it is retrieved.
pre_option_option.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

Passing a truthy value to the filter will short-circuit retrieving the option value, returning the passed value instead.

pre_option.label: pre_option
pre_option.description: The value to return instead of the option value. This differs from $default, which is used as the fallback value in the event the option doesn't exist elsewhere in get_option(). Default false (to skip past the short-circuit).

default.label: default
default.description: The fallback value to return if the option does not exist. Default is false.

pre_post_link.name: pre_post_link
pre_post_link.summary: Filters the permalink structure for a post before token replacement occurs.
pre_post_link.description: Only applies to posts with post_type of 'post'.

leavename.label: leavename
leavename.description: Whether to keep the post name.

pre_prepare_themes_for_js.name: pre_prepare_themes_for_js
pre_prepare_themes_for_js.summary: Filters theme data before it is prepared for JavaScript.
pre_prepare_themes_for_js.description: Passing a non-empty array will result in wp_prepare_themes_for_js() returning early with that value instead.

prepared_themes.label: prepared_themes
prepared_themes.description: An associative array of theme data. Default empty array.

themes.label: themes
themes.description: An array of theme objects to prepare, if any.

remote_source.label: remote_source
remote_source.description: Response source for the page linked from.

pagelinkedto.label: pagelinkedto
pagelinkedto.description: URL of the page linked to.

pre_render_block.name: pre_render_block
pre_render_block.summary: Allows render_block() to be shortcircuited, by returning a non-null value.

pre_reschedule_event.name: pre_reschedule_event
pre_reschedule_event.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack rescheduling of events.
pre_reschedule_event.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit the normal rescheduling process, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, return true if the event was successfully rescheduled, false if not.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue adding the event.

event.label: event
event.description:
An object containing an event's data.
  • 'hook'
    (string) Action hook to execute when the event is run.
  • 'timestamp'
    (int) Unix timestamp (UTC) for when to next run the event.
  • 'schedule'
    (string|false) How often the event should subsequently recur.
  • 'args'
    (array) Array containing each separate argument to pass to the hook's callback function.
  • 'interval'
    (int) The interval time in seconds for the schedule. Only present for recurring events.

pre_schedule_event.name: pre_schedule_event
pre_schedule_event.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack scheduling an event.
pre_schedule_event.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit adding the event to the cron array, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

Both single events and recurring events are passed through this filter; single events have $event->schedule as false, whereas recurring events have this set to a recurrence from wp_get_schedules(). Recurring events also have the integer recurrence interval set as $event->interval.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, it is recommended you check for an identical event within ten minutes and apply the {@see 'schedule_event'} filter to check if another plugin has disallowed the event before scheduling.

Return true if the event was scheduled, false if not.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue adding the event.

event.label: event
event.description:
An object containing an event's data.
  • 'hook'
    (string) Action hook to execute when the event is run.
  • 'timestamp'
    (int) Unix timestamp (UTC) for when to next run the event.
  • 'schedule'
    (string|false) How often the event should subsequently recur.
  • 'args'
    (array) Array containing each separate argument to pass to the hook's callback function.
  • 'interval'
    (int) The interval time in seconds for the schedule. Only present for recurring events.

pre_set_site_transient_transient.name: pre_set_site_transient_{$transient}
pre_set_site_transient_transient.summary: Filters the value of a specific site transient before it is set.
pre_set_site_transient_transient.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

pre_set_theme_mod_name.name: pre_set_theme_mod_{$name}
pre_set_theme_mod_name.summary: Filters the theme mod value on save.
pre_set_theme_mod_name.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $name, refers to the key name of the modification array. For example, 'header_textcolor', 'header_image', and so on depending on the theme options.

value.label: value
value.description: The new value of the theme mod.

old_value.label: old_value
old_value.description: The current value of the theme mod.

pre_set_transient_transient.name: pre_set_transient_{$transient}
pre_set_transient_transient.summary: Filters a specific transient before its value is set.
pre_set_transient_transient.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

pre_site_option_option.name: pre_site_option_{$option}
pre_site_option_option.summary: Filters an existing network option before it is retrieved.
pre_site_option_option.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

Passing a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit retrieval, returning the passed value instead.

pre_option.label: pre_option
pre_option.description: The value to return instead of the option value. This differs from $default, which is used as the fallback value in the event the option doesn't exist elsewhere in get_network_option(). Default is false (to skip past the short-circuit).

default.label: default
default.description: The fallback value to return if the option does not exist. Default is false.

pre_site_transient_transient.name: pre_site_transient_{$transient}
pre_site_transient_transient.summary: Filters the value of an existing site transient.
pre_site_transient_transient.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

Passing a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit retrieval, returning the passed value instead.

pre_site_transient.label: pre_site_transient
pre_site_transient.description: The default value to return if the site transient does not exist. Any value other than false will short-circuit the retrieval of the transient, and return the returned value.

pre_taxonomy_field.name: pre_{$taxonomy}_{$field}
pre_taxonomy_field.summary: Filters a taxonomy field before it is sanitized.
pre_taxonomy_field.description: The dynamic portions of the filter name, $taxonomy and $field, refer to the taxonomy slug and field name, respectively.

pre_term_field.name: pre_term_{$field}
pre_term_field.summary: Filters a term field value before it is sanitized.
pre_term_field.description: The dynamic portion of the filter name, $field, refers to the term field.

pre_term_link.name: pre_term_link
pre_term_link.summary: Filters the permalink structure for a terms before token replacement occurs.

termlink.label: termlink
termlink.description: The permalink structure for the term's taxonomy.

pre_transient_transient.name: pre_transient_{$transient}
pre_transient_transient.summary: Filters the value of an existing transient.
pre_transient_transient.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $transient, refers to the transient name.

Passing a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit retrieval of the transient, returning the passed value instead.

pre_transient.label: pre_transient
pre_transient.description: The default value to return if the transient does not exist. Any value other than false will short-circuit the retrieval of the transient, and return the returned value.

pre_trash_post.name: pre_trash_post
pre_trash_post.summary: Filters whether a post trashing should take place.

trash.label: trash
trash.description: Whether to go forward with trashing.

pre_unschedule_event.name: pre_unschedule_event
pre_unschedule_event.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack unscheduling of events.
pre_unschedule_event.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit the normal unscheduling process, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, return true if the event was successfully unscheduled, false if not.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue unscheduling the event.

timestamp.label: timestamp
timestamp.description: Timestamp for when to run the event.

hook.label: hook
hook.description: Action hook, the execution of which will be unscheduled.

args.label: args
args.description: Arguments to pass to the hook's callback function.

pre_unschedule_hook.name: pre_unschedule_hook
pre_unschedule_hook.summary: Filter to preflight or hijack clearing all events attached to the hook.
pre_unschedule_hook.description:
Returning a non-null value will short-circuit the normal unscheduling process, causing the function to return the filtered value instead.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, return the number of events successfully unscheduled (zero if no events were registered with the hook) or false if unscheduling one or more events fails.

pre.label: pre
pre.description: Value to return instead. Default null to continue unscheduling the hook.

hook.label: hook
hook.description: Action hook, the execution of which will be unscheduled.

pre_untrash_post.name: pre_untrash_post
pre_untrash_post.summary: Filters whether a post untrashing should take place.

untrash.label: untrash
untrash.description: Whether to go forward with untrashing.

pre_update_option.name: pre_update_option
pre_update_option.summary: Filters an option before its value is (maybe) serialized and updated.

pre_update_option_option.summary: Filters a specific option before its value is (maybe) serialized and updated.
pre_update_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

pre_update_site_option_option.name: pre_update_site_option_{$option}
pre_update_site_option_option.summary: Filters a specific network option before its value is updated.
pre_update_site_option_option.description: The dynamic portion of the hook name, $option, refers to the option name.

value.label: value
value.description: New value of the network option.

old_value.label: old_value
old_value.description: Old value of the network option.

pre_upload_error.name: pre_upload_error
pre_upload_error.summary: Filters whether to preempt the XML-RPC media upload.
pre_upload_error.description: Passing a truthy value will effectively short-circuit the media upload, returning that value as a 500 error instead.

pre_user_first_name.name: pre_user_first_name
pre_user_first_name.summary: Filters a user's first name before the user is created or updated.

pre_user_url.summary: Filters a user's URL before the user is created or updated.

pre_wp_update_comment_count_now.summary: Filters a post's comment count before it is updated in the database.

form_post.label: form_post
form_post.description: The URL to post the form to.

rest_authentication_errors.name: rest_authentication_errors
rest_authentication_errors.description:
This is used to pass a WP_Error from an authentication method back to the API.

Authentication methods should check first if they're being used, as multiple authentication methods can be enabled on a site (cookies, HTTP basic auth, OAuth). If the authentication method hooked in is not actually being attempted, null should be returned to indicate another authentication method should check instead. Similarly, callbacks should ensure the value is null before checking for errors.

A WP_Error instance can be returned if an error occurs, and this should match the format used by API methods internally (that is, the status data should be used). A callback can return true to indicate that the authentication method was used, and it succeeded.

outputs.description: WP_Error if authentication error, null if authentication method wasn't used, true if authentication succeeded.

Allows plugins to perform any needed cleanup, for example, to undo changes made during the {@see 'rest_request_before_callbacks'} filter.

Note that this filter will not be called for requests that fail to authenticate or match to a registered route.

Note that an endpoint's permission_callback can still be called after this filter - see rest_send_allow_header().

order.label: order

type.label: type
type.description: The type to check. }

rest_response_link_curies.name: rest_response_link_curies
rest_response_link_curies.summary: Filters extra CURIEs available on API responses.
rest_response_link_curies.description:
CURIEs allow a shortened version of URI relations. This allows a more usable form for custom relations than using the full URI. These work similarly to how XML namespaces work.

Registered CURIES need to specify a name and URI template. This will automatically transform URI relations into their shortened version. The shortened relation follows the format {name}:{rel}. {rel} in the URI template will be replaced with the {rel} part of the shortened relation.

For example, a CURIE with name example and URI template http://w.org/{rel} would transform a http://w.org/term relation into example:term.

Well-behaved clients should expand and normalise these back to their full URI relation, however some naive clients may not resolve these correctly, so adding new CURIEs may break backward compatibility.

additional.label: additional
additional.description: Additional CURIEs to register with the API.

rest_route_data.name: rest_route_data
rest_route_data.summary: Filters the publicly-visible data for routes.
rest_route_data.description: This data is exposed on indexes and can be used by clients or developers to investigate the site and find out how to use it. It acts as a form of self-documentation.

available.label: available
available.description: Map of route to route data.

routes.label: routes
routes.description: Internal route data as an associative array.

By default, administrators are notified when the update offer received from WordPress.org sets a particular flag. This allows some discretion in if and when to notify.

This filter is only evaluated once per release. If the same email address was already notified of the same new version, WordPress won't repeatedly email the administrator.

This filter is also used on about.php to check if a plugin has disabled these notifications.

show_advanced_plugins.name: show_advanced_plugins
show_advanced_plugins.summary: Filters whether to display the advanced plugins list table.
show_advanced_plugins.description:
There are two types of advanced plugins - must-use and drop-ins - which can be used in a single site or Multisite network.

The $type parameter allows you to differentiate between the type of advanced plugins to filter the display of. Contexts include 'mustuse' and 'dropins'.

show.label: show
show.description: Whether to show the advanced plugins for the specified plugin type. Default true.

type.description: The plugin type. Accepts 'mustuse', 'dropins'.

show_network_active_plugins.name: show_network_active_plugins
show_network_active_plugins.summary: Filters whether to display network-active plugins alongside plugins active for the current site.
show_network_active_plugins.description:
This also controls the display of inactive network-only plugins (plugins with "Network: true" in the plugin header).

Plugins cannot be network-activated or network-deactivated from this screen.

show.label: show
show.description: Whether to show network-active plugins. Default is whether the current user can manage network plugins (ie. a Super Admin).

show_network_site_users_add_existing_for.name: show_network_site_users_add_existing_form

email_change_email.label: email_change_email
email_change_email.description:
Used to build wp_mail().
  • 'to'
    (string) The intended recipient.
  • 'subject'
    (string) The subject of the email.
  • 'message'
    (string) The content of the email. The following strings have a special meaning and will get replaced dynamically: - ###OLD_EMAIL### The old site admin email address. - ###NEW_EMAIL### The new site admin email address. - ###SITENAME### The name of the site. - ###SITEURL### The URL to the site.
  • 'headers'
    (string) Headers.

An array of taxonomy parent drop-down arguments.
  • 'hide_empty'
    (int|bool) Whether to hide terms not attached to any posts. Default 0|false.
  • 'hide_if_empty'
    (bool) Whether to hide the drop-down if no terms exist. Default false.
  • 'taxonomy'
    (string) The taxonomy slug.
  • 'name'
    (string) Value of the name attribute to use for the drop-down select element. Default 'parent'.
  • 'orderby'
    (string) The field to order by. Default 'name'.
  • 'hierarchical'
    (bool) Whether the taxonomy is hierarchical. Default true.
  • 'show_option_none'
    (string) Label to display if there are no terms. Default 'None'.

theme_action_links.name: theme_action_links
theme_action_links.summary: Filters the action links displayed for each theme in the Multisite themes list table.
theme_action_links.description:
The action links displayed are determined by the theme's status, and which Multisite themes list table is being displayed - the Network themes list table (themes.php), which displays all installed themes, or the Site themes list table (site-themes.php), which displays the non-network enabled themes when editing a site in the Network admin.

The default action links for the Network themes list table include 'Network Enable', 'Network Disable', and 'Delete'.

The default action links for the Site themes list table include 'Enable', and 'Disable'.

context.label: context
context.description: Status of the theme, one of 'all', 'enabled', or 'disabled'.

themes_api.name: themes_api
themes_api.summary: Filters whether to override the WordPress.org Themes API.
themes_api.description:
Passing a non-false value will effectively short-circuit the WordPress.org API request.

If $action is 'query_themes', 'theme_information', or 'feature_list', an object MUST be passed. If $action is 'hot_tags', an array should be passed.

type_template.name: {$type}_template
type_template.summary: Filters the path of the queried template by type.
type_template.description:
The dynamic portion of the hook name, $type, refers to the filename -- minus the file extension and any non-alphanumeric characters delimiting words -- of the file to load. This hook also applies to various types of files loaded as part of the Template Hierarchy.

Possible values for $type include: 'index', '404', 'archive', 'author', 'category', 'tag', 'taxonomy', 'date', 'embed', 'home', 'frontpage', 'page', 'paged', 'search', 'single', 'singular', and 'attachment'.

The last element in the array should always be the fallback template for this query type.

Possible values for $type include: 'index', '404', 'archive', 'author', 'category', 'tag', 'taxonomy', 'date', 'embed', 'home', 'frontpage', 'page', 'paged', 'search', 'single', 'singular', and 'attachment'.

templates.label: templates

update_custom_css_data.name: update_custom_css_data
update_custom_css_data.summary: Filters the `css` (`post_content`) and `preprocessed` (`post_content_filtered`) args for a `custom_css` post being updated.
update_custom_css_data.description:
This filter can be used by plugin that offer CSS pre-processors, to store the original pre-processed CSS in post_content_filtered and then store processed CSS in post_content. When used in this way, the post_content_filtered should be supplied as the setting value instead of post_content via a the customize_value_custom_css filter, for example:

add_filter( 'customize_value_custom_css', function( $value, $setting ) { $post = wp_get_custom_css_post( $setting->stylesheet ); if ( $post && ! empty( $post->post_content_filtered ) ) { $css = $post->post_content_filtered; } return $css; }, 10, 2 );

data.label: data
data.description:
Custom CSS data.
  • 'css'
    (string) CSS stored in post_content.
  • 'preprocessed'
    (string) Pre-processed CSS stored in post_content_filtered. Normally empty string.

args.label: args
args.description:
The args passed into wp_update_custom_css_post() merged with defaults.
  • 'css'
    (string) The original CSS passed in to be updated.
  • 'preprocessed'
    (string) The original preprocessed CSS passed in to be updated.
  • 'stylesheet'
    (string) The stylesheet (theme) being updated.

update_feedback.name: update_feedback
update_feedback.summary: Filters feedback messages displayed during the core update process.
update_feedback.description:
The filter is first evaluated after the zip file for the latest version has been downloaded and unzipped. It is evaluated five more times during the process:

  • Before WordPress begins the core upgrade process.
  • Before Maintenance Mode is enabled.
  • Before WordPress begins copying over the necessary files.
  • Before Maintenance Mode is disabled.
  • Before the database is upgraded.

options.label: options
options.description:
Options used by the upgrader.
  • 'package'
    (string) Package for update.
  • 'destination'
    (string) Update location.
  • 'clear_destination'
    (bool) Clear the destination resource.
  • 'clear_working'
    (bool) Clear the working resource.
  • 'abort_if_destination_exists'
    (bool) Abort if the Destination directory exists.
  • 'is_multi'
    (bool) Whether the upgrader is running multiple times.
  • 'hook_extra'
    (array) Extra hook arguments.
    • 'action'
      (string) Type of action. Default 'update'.
    • 'type'
      (string) Type of update process. Accepts 'plugin', 'theme', or 'core'.
    • 'bulk'
      (bool) Whether the update process is a bulk update. Default true.
    • 'plugin'
      (string) Path to the plugin file relative to the plugins directory.
    • 'theme'
      (string) The stylesheet or template name of the theme.
    • 'language_update_type'
      (string) The language pack update type. Accepts 'plugin', 'theme', or 'core'.
    • 'language_update'
      (object) The language pack update offer.

The post is considered "empty" if both:

  • The post type supports the title, editor, and excerpt fields
  • The title, editor, and excerpt fields are all empty

Plugins with different uniqueness requirements may use this filter to bypass or modify the duplicate-term check.

Values and keys for the user.
  • 'user_login'

  • 'user_pass'

    (string) The user's url.

  • 'display_name'

revisions_data.description:
The bootstrapped data for the revisions screen.
  • 'id'
    (int) Revision ID.
  • 'title'
    (string) Title for the revision's parent WP_Post object.
  • 'author'
    (int) Revision post author ID.
  • 'date'
    (string) Date the revision was modified.
  • 'dateShort'
    (string) Short-form version of the date the revision was modified.
  • 'timeAgo'
    (string) GMT-aware amount of time ago the revision was modified.
  • 'autosave'
    (bool) Whether the revision is an autosave.
  • 'current'
    (bool) Whether the revision is both not an autosave and the post modified date matches the revision modified date (GMT-aware).
  • 'restoreUrl'
    (bool|false) URL if the revision can be restored, false otherwise.

EXPIRATION### The date when the URL will be automatically deleted. LINK### URL of the personal data export file for the user. SITENAME### The name of the site. SITEURL### The URL to the site.

wpmu_validate_blog_signup.name: wpmu_validate_blog_signup
wpmu_validate_blog_signup.summary: Filters site details and error messages following registration.

result.label: result
result.description:
Array of domain, path, blog name, blog title, user and error messages.
  • 'domain'
    (string) Domain for the site.
  • 'path'
    (string) Path for the site. Used in subdirectory installations.
  • 'blogname'
    (string) The unique site name (slug).
  • 'blog_title'
    (string) Blog title.
  • 'user'
    (string|WP_User) By default, an empty string. A user object if provided.
  • 'errors'
    (WP_Error) WP_Error containing any errors found.

result.description:
The array of user name, email and the error messages.

    (string) Sanitized and unique username.
  • 'orig_username'
    (string) Original username.
  • 'user_email'
    (string) User email address.
  • 'errors'
    (WP_Error) WP_Error object containing any errors found.

xmlrpc_enabled.name: xmlrpc_enabled
xmlrpc_enabled.summary: Filters whether XML-RPC methods requiring authentication are enabled.
xmlrpc_enabled.description:
Contrary to the way it's named, this filter does not control whether XML-RPC is fully enabled, rather, it only controls whether XML-RPC methods requiring authentication - such as for publishing purposes - are enabled.

Further, the filter does not control whether pingbacks or other custom endpoints that don't require authentication are enabled. This behavior is expected, and due to how parity was matched with the enable_xmlrpc UI option the filter replaced when it was introduced in 3.5.

To disable XML-RPC methods that require authentication, use:

add_filter( 'xmlrpc_enabled', '__return_false' );

For more granular control over all XML-RPC methods and requests, see the {@see 'xmlrpc_methods'} and {@see 'xmlrpc_element_limit'} hooks.

enabled.label: enabled
enabled.description: Whether XML-RPC is enabled. Default true.

xmlrpc_methods.description: This filter can be used to add new methods, and remove built-in methods.
